metadata.title: NBA CBA Study Materials - Batch 3: Article X - Player Eligibility and NBA Draft

studyNote: Article X covers NBA Draft eligibility, draft rights, and the draft process. These are frequently tested topics as agents must know when players are eligible and how draft rights work.

questions.question: What is the minimum age requirement for a player to be eligible for the NBA Draft?
questions.explanation: Players must be at least 19 years old during the calendar year of the draft. Additionally, at least one NBA season must have elapsed since their high school graduation.

questions.question: How much time must elapse between a player's high school graduation and draft eligibility?
questions.explanation: At least one NBA season must have elapsed since the player's high school class graduated, even if the player turned 19 earlier.

questions.question: Can a player who turns 19 in December be drafted in the June draft of that same year?
options: No, must be 19 during the calendar year of the draft AND one NBA season after HS graduation
questions.explanation: The player must meet BOTH requirements: be 19 during the calendar year of the draft AND have at least one NBA season elapse since HS graduation.

questions.question: What is an 'early entry' player?
options: A player who declares for the draft before their college eligibility expires
questions.explanation: An early entry player is someone who makes themselves eligible for the draft before exhausting their college eligibility, typically college underclassmen.

questions.question: By when must an early entry player withdraw from the draft to retain college eligibility?
options: By the early entry withdrawal deadline set by the NBA (typically mid-May)
questions.explanation: The NBA sets a specific early entry withdrawal deadline each year, typically in mid-May. Players must withdraw by this date to retain NCAA eligibility.

questions.question: How long does a team have exclusive negotiating rights to a first-round draft pick?
options: Until one year after the draft OR one year after college class graduates, whichever is later
questions.explanation: Teams have exclusive rights until the later of: one year from the draft date, or one year after the player's college class graduates.

questions.question: What happens if a first-round pick doesn't sign with the team that drafted him within the exclusive negotiating period?
options: He becomes a free agent immediately
Team loses draft rights and player enters next draft
Team retains rights for another year
Player can sign with any team
questions.explanation: If a first-round pick doesn't sign during the team's exclusive negotiating period, the team loses its draft rights and the player becomes eligible for the next draft.

questions.question: How long does a team have exclusive rights to a second-round draft pick?
options: No exclusive rights, they become free agents immediately
questions.explanation: Second-round picks do NOT receive the same protections as first-round picks. They can become free agents and sign with any team after the draft.

questions.question: Can international players who are playing professionally overseas declare for the draft?
options: Yes, if they meet age requirements and declare by deadline
Only if released by their team
questions.explanation: International players playing professionally can declare for the draft if they meet the age requirements (19 years old, one year after HS graduation equivalent).

questions.question: What is a 'draft and follow' arrangement?
options: Drafting a player and trading him
This no longer exists in the current CBA
questions.explanation: The 'draft and follow' system (where teams could draft players and retain rights while they played overseas) was eliminated in previous CBAs.

questions.question: By what date must a player declare for the draft as an early entry candidate?
options: The early entry declaration deadline set by the NBA (typically 60 days before draft)
questions.explanation: The NBA sets an early entry declaration deadline each year, typically about 60 days before the draft (usually in late April).

questions.question: Can a player declare for the draft multiple times without being drafted?
options: Yes, unlimited times if they maintain eligibility
Yes, but only if they withdraw before deadline
questions.explanation: A player can declare for multiple drafts as long as they withdraw before the deadline each time (if they want to retain college eligibility).

questions.question: What is the NBA Draft Combine?
options: A required workout for all draft prospects
An optional pre-draft event where players can showcase skills, do medical exams, and interview with teams
questions.explanation: The Draft Combine is an optional event (though highly encouraged) where draft prospects participate in drills, measurements, medical exams, and team interviews.

questions.question: Can teams conduct private workouts with draft prospects outside the combine?
options: Yes, teams can conduct individual workouts
questions.explanation: Teams are permitted to conduct individual workouts with draft prospects in addition to or instead of combine participation.

questions.question: If a player is drafted by a team, can the team trade his draft rights before he signs?
options: Yes, draft rights can be traded
questions.explanation: Teams can trade draft rights to players they've selected, either on draft night or later, without the player having signed a contract.

questions.question: How many rounds are in the NBA Draft?
questions.explanation: The NBA Draft consists of 2 rounds, with 30 picks in each round (one for each team), for a total of 60 picks.

questions.question: Can a team lose their draft pick as punishment for violating CBA rules?
options: No, draft picks cannot be forfeited
Yes, the Commissioner can take away draft picks for certain violations
questions.explanation: The Commissioner has authority to take away draft picks as punishment for serious CBA violations, including circumvention and other misconduct.

questions.question: What happens if a drafted player plays professionally in another league after being drafted?
options: Team retains draft rights but player's Rookie Scale amount is excluded from cap while playing overseas
questions.explanation: If a first-round pick plays overseas, the team retains his rights but his cap hold is temporarily removed while he's under contract abroad.
questions.source: Article X, Section 4(c) & Article VII, Section 4(e)(2)

questions.question: Can a team renounce their draft rights to a player they selected?
options: Yes, teams can renounce draft rights to create cap space
questions.explanation: Teams can renounce their exclusive draft rights to first-round picks (usually to create salary cap space), making the player a free agent.

questions.question: What is required for a player from a foreign country to be draft eligible?
options: Same age requirements as US players (19 during calendar year)
questions.explanation: International players have the same age eligibility requirements as US players: must be 19 during the calendar year of the draft.

questions.question: If a player is automatically eligible (4 years after HS graduation) but doesn't declare, what happens?
options: Automatically included in draft pool even without declaring
questions.explanation: Players who are four years removed from high school graduation are automatically eligible and don't need to declare - they're automatically in the draft pool.

questions.question: Can a player hire an agent and still withdraw from the draft to retain college eligibility?
options: Yes, new NCAA rules allow this
No, hiring an agent makes the player permanently ineligible for college
questions.explanation: Recent NCAA rule changes allow players to hire agents and still withdraw from the draft by the deadline to retain college eligibility, under certain conditions.

questions.question: How are draft picks allocated to teams?
options: Based on prior season record (worst teams pick first), with lottery for non-playoff teams
All teams pick in random order
questions.explanation: The draft lottery determines the order for the top picks among non-playoff teams, with remaining picks based on reverse order of record.

questions.question: Can teams trade future draft picks?
options: Yes, teams can trade picks up to 7 years in advance
questions.explanation: Teams can trade draft picks up to 7 years in the future, though the 'Stepien Rule' prevents trading picks in consecutive years.

questions.question: What is the 'Stepien Rule'?
options: A rule preventing teams from trading first-round picks in consecutive years
questions.explanation: The Stepien Rule (named after former Cavaliers owner Ted Stepien) prevents teams from trading away first-round picks in consecutive years to protect franchises.

questions.question: Can a player who went undrafted become a free agent immediately?
options: Yes, undrafted players are unrestricted free agents and can sign with any team
questions.explanation: Players who are not selected in the draft become unrestricted free agents immediately and can sign with any team (often for Summer League initially).

questions.question: What medical information can teams request from draft prospects?
options: Complete medical records with player consent
questions.explanation: Teams can request comprehensive medical information from draft prospects, but players must consent to sharing their medical records.

questions.question: If there's a dispute about whether a player is eligible for the draft, who decides?
options: The NBA Commissioner makes the final determination
questions.explanation: The Commissioner has the authority to make final determinations on draft eligibility disputes, subject to certain appeal rights.

questions.question: Can expansion teams participate in the regular NBA Draft?
options: No, they have separate expansion drafts only
Yes, expansion teams receive picks in the regular draft, typically toward the end of the first round
questions.explanation: Expansion teams participate in the regular NBA Draft and typically receive additional picks, often selecting near the end of the first round.

questions.question: What happens to the draft rights of a player who retires without ever playing in the NBA?
options: Team loses rights when player retires
questions.explanation: If a drafted player retires without playing in the NBA, the team's exclusive rights to that player are typically lost.
